Newmarket Library

Manager: Kate Ashton

1a the Guineas, Newmarket
CB8 8EQ

Tel: 01638 661216
Fax: 01638 560818
Email: help@suffolklibraries.co.uk
Friends group: Friends of Newmarket Library

Social media:

  • Facebook
  • Twitter

Branch updates

Newmarket Library is currently looking for volunteers for the Summer Reading Challenge for Tuesday afternoons, Fridays and weekends. It is also looking for volunteers for its new Code Club.

Branch facilities

  • Accessibility information
  • Payments: cash, cheques and cards accepted
  • Special collections: Racing collection
  • Parking: two public car parks within 5 minutes' walk
  • Out-of-hours book return available
  • Display space: Wall space available for exhibition hire
  • Which? available - ask staff for magazine or to log in
  • For sale:
    • Poetry book collated by Newmarket Library Friend Christine - £5 each with all proceeds to Friends of Newmarket Library and St Nicholas Hospice.
    • Friends of Newmarket Library 2018 calendars - £5.95.
  • Also available:
    • Laminating service - £1 for A4, £2 for A3. Please allow 30 minutes for laminating. We cannot accept responsibility for any damage so laminating copies rather than originals of valuable items.
    • Shopmobility: hire an electric mobility scooter from Newmarket Library.

IT and printing facilities

  • Free wifi
  • Book a computer
  • Borrow a BBC micro:bit
  • Photocopying: available in A3 and A4, black and white and colour
  • Colour printing: available
  • Scan to email
  • Fax
  • Printing, photocopying & scanning charges

Opening hours

Day Hours
Monday Closed
Tuesday 0830 – 1800
Wednesday 0900 – 1700
Thursday 0830 – 1700
Friday 0830 – 1830
Saturday 0900 – 1700
Sunday 1000 – 1600

Regular events and activities

Children's events

Baby Bounce

Tuesday, 1000-1030

Soothing songs and gentle nursery rhymes for babies. We are currently looking for volunteers to help with these sessions. If you are interested, please ask a member of staff.

Find out more about our Bookstart sessions

Code Club: for 9+ year-olds

Coming soon to Saturday mornings, TBC

Contact the library to reserve a space.

Craft activities: for primary school age children

Sunday, 1100-1500

"Sharing" Time: Stories, songs and crafts for children and their carers with Sharing Parenting.

Last Thursday of each month. No session in August., 1000

Storytime: for 2-5 year olds

Wednesday, 1000-1030

Find out more about our Bookstart sessions

Tot Rock

Thursday, 1030-1100

Songs and action rhymes for toddlers. We are currently looking for volunteers to help with these sessions. If you are interested, please contact the library.

Find out more about our Bookstart sessions

Summer Reading Challenge

Summer Reading Challenge

Tuesday-Sunday from 22 July, 1000-1600

Talk to a volunteer about your latest read, borrow your next book and collect rewards for your Summer Reading Challenge progress.

Older people's events

Top Time: events and activities for older people

Thursday, 1030-1100

Top Time: events and activities for older people

Thursday, 1430-1530

Language courses

Conversation classes for people looking to improve their English

Sunday, 1230-1330

Term-time only.

Arts, crafts & games

Knit and Natter

Saturday, 1400

Bring your work in progress along and have a chat while you knit or crochet. Refreshments provided.

Knit and Natter

Tuesdays, 1400

Bring your work in progress along and have a chat while you knit or crochet. Refreshments provided.

Health & wellbeing events

Open space: drop in for health info and chats. All welcome, free tea and coffee provided.

Wednesdays, 1430-1630

Fundraising, stalls & book sales

Book sale

last Saturday and Sunday of the month. No sale in July or August., library opening hours
